00071 static void
00072 R_renumber_oper_vreg (L_Oper * oper, int fvreg_id, int tvreg_id)
00073 {
00074   int i;
00075   L_Attr *attr;
00076   L_Operand *opd;
00077 
00078   if (!oper)
00079     return;
00080 
00081   for (i = 0; i < L_max_pred_operand; i++)
00082     {
00083       if (!(opd = oper->pred[i]))
00084         continue;
00085 
00086       if (L_is_reg (opd) && opd->value.r == fvreg_id)
00087         opd->value.r = tvreg_id;
00088     }
00089   for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00090     {
00091       if (!(opd = oper->dest[i]))
00092         continue;
00093 
00094       if (L_is_reg (opd) && opd->value.r == fvreg_id)
00095         opd->value.r = tvreg_id;
00096     }
00097   for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
00098     {
00099       if (!(opd = oper->src[i]))
00100         continue;
00101 
00102       if (L_is_reg (opd) && opd->value.r == fvreg_id)
00103         opd->value.r = tvreg_id;
00104     }
00105   /* EMN: Extended source support */
00106   if ((oper->opc == Lop_CHECK) && (attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "src")))
00107     {
00108       for (i = 0; i < attr->max_field; i++)
00109         {
00110           if (!(opd = attr->field[i]))
00111             continue;
00112           if (L_is_reg (opd) && opd->value.r == fvreg_id)
00113             opd->value.r = tvreg_id;
00114         }
00115     }
00116   return;
00117 }
00118 
00119 
00120 static void
00121 R_cbsplit_spilled_live_range (L_Func * fn, R_Reg * vreg, Stack * vreg_stack)
00122 {
00123   int i, j, n_instr, n_cb, ctype;
00124   R_Reg *new_vreg;
00125   R_Arc *iarcs, *arc;
00126   double max_weight;
00127   int *cbuf = R_buf;
00128   L_Oper **ibuf = (L_Oper **) R_pbuf;
00129   Set cbset = NULL;
00130   int use_invariant = R_Invariant_Vreg_Priorities;
00131 
00132 #if 0
00133   fprintf (stdout, "CB Splitting VREG #%d\n", vreg->index);
00134 #endif
00135 
00136   n_instr = Set_2array (vreg->live_range, (int *) cbuf);
00137   for (i = 0; i < n_instr; i++)
00138     {
00139       L_Cb *cb;
00140 
00141       /* find L_Cb * from the oper id's */
00142 
00143       cb = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_cb (fn->oper_hash_tbl, cbuf[i]);
00144       cbset = Set_add (cbset, cb->id);
00145 
00146       /* find L_Oper * from the oper id's */
00147       ibuf[i] = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl, cbuf[i]);
00148     }
00149   n_cb = Set_2array (cbset, cbuf);
00150   Set_dispose (cbset);
00151 
00152   if (n_cb <= 1)
00153     {
00154       /* there is no point to doing any of this */
00155       vreg->flags |= R_CB_SPLIT;
00156       return;
00157     }
00158 
00159   /* save the interferences arcs of the live range */
00160   iarcs = vreg->interfere;
00161   vreg->interfere = NULL;
00162   ctype = R_conv_type_to_Ltype (vreg->type);
00163 
00164   /* cb split the spilled live range */
00165   for (i = 0; i < n_cb; i++)
00166     {
00167       int new_id;
00168       Set live_range = NULL;
00169 
00170       /* select id for new live range */
00171       if (i == 0)
00172         {
00173           /* the first cb will remain in the original live range */
00174           new_id = vreg->index;
00175           vreg->live_range = Set_dispose (vreg->live_range);
00176         }
00177       else
00178         {
00179           new_id = R_find_free_vreg ();
00180           new_vreg = R_add_register (new_id, ctype, 0.0, 0);
00181         }
00182 
00183 #if 0
00184       fprintf (stdout, "\t-> Creating new vreg #%d\n", new_id);
00185       fprintf (stdout, "\t---> Contains instr: ");
00186 #endif
00187       /* determine the portion of the live range */
00188       /* belonging to the current cb             */
00189       for (j = 0; j < n_instr; j++)
00190         {
00191           int id = ibuf[j]->id;
00192           L_Cb *cb = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_cb (fn->oper_hash_tbl, id);
00193           if (cb->id == cbuf[i])
00194             {
00195               live_range = Set_add (live_range, id);
00196               R_renumber_oper_vreg (ibuf[j], vreg->index, new_id);
00197 #if 0
00198               fprintf (stdout, "%d ", ibuf[j]);
00199 #endif
00200             }
00201         }
00202 #if 0
00203       fprintf (stdout, "\n");
00204 #endif
00205       new_vreg = VREG (new_id);
00206       new_vreg->flags |= (R_SPILLED | R_CB_SPLIT);
00207       new_vreg->ref_instr = new_vreg->live_range = Set_copy (live_range);
00208 
00209       if (i != 0)
00210         {
00211           new_vreg->spill_loc = vreg->spill_loc;
00212           new_vreg->pvreg = vreg;
00213         }
00214       new_vreg->illegal_reg = Set_copy (vreg->illegal_reg);
00215       new_vreg->constraints = Set_copy (vreg->constraints);
00216 
00217       new_vreg->caller_benefit = 1;
00218       new_vreg->callee_benefit = 0;
00219       new_vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
00220 
00221       /* if we are to use "invariant" priorities, use register id
00222        * rather than profile/static based priority */
00223 
00224       max_weight = (!use_invariant) ? vreg->priority : (double) vreg->index;
00225 
00226       /* determine the interferences of the new live range */
00227       for (arc = iarcs; arc; arc = arc->next)
00228         {
00229           double arc_weight = (!use_invariant) ? arc->lr->priority:
00230             (double) arc->lr->index;
00231 
00232           if (arc_weight > max_weight)
00233             max_weight = arc_weight;
00234 
00235           if (Set_intersect_empty (new_vreg->ref_instr, arc->lr->live_range))
00236             {
00237               /* if the live ranges do not interfere, and this is the
00238                * original live range, remove the arc, otherwise
00239                * nothing needs to be done. */
00240               if (i == 0)
00241                 R_remove_interference (arc->lr, vreg);
00242             }
00243           else
00244             {
00245               /* if they interefere, and this the original live range
00246               * we ned only add an arc to new_vreg.  Otherwise, we
00247               * remove the old arc and add new arcs. */
00248               if (i != 0)
00249                 R_add_interference_arc (new_vreg, arc->lr);
00250 
00251               R_add_interference_arc (arc->lr, new_vreg);
00252             }
00253         }
00254       /* assign new priority */
00255       new_vreg->priority = max_weight + 1.0;
00256 
00257       if (i != 0)
00258         Push_Top (vreg_stack, new_vreg);
00259 
00260       live_range = Set_dispose (live_range);
00261     }
00262   return;
00263 }
00264 
00265 
00266 static void
00267 R_isplit_spilled_live_range (L_Func * fn, R_Reg * vreg, Stack * vreg_stack)
00268 {
00269   int k, ctype, free_register, new_id, n;
00270   R_Arc *iarcs, *arc, *next_arc;
00271   R_Reg *new_vreg;
00272   L_Cb *cb;
00273   L_Oper *oper;
00274   double max_weight;
00275   Set ref_instr = NULL, live_range = NULL, reserved_resource = NULL,
00276     cres = NULL;
00277   int *nbor = R_buf;
00278   int use_invariant = R_Invariant_Vreg_Priorities;
00279 
00280 #if 0
00281   fprintf (stdout, "INSTR Splitting VREG #%d\n", vreg->index);
00282 #endif
00283 
00284   /* save the interferences arcs of the live range */
00285   iarcs = vreg->interfere;
00286   vreg->interfere = NULL;
00287   ctype = R_conv_type_to_Ltype (vreg->type);
00288 
00289   ref_instr = Set_copy (vreg->ref_instr);
00290   Set_2array (ref_instr, nbor);
00291 
00292   /* identify the largest allocatable portion of the live range */
00293 
00294   cb = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_cb (fn->oper_hash_tbl, nbor[0]);
00295   for (oper = cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00296     {
00297       if (!Set_in (ref_instr, oper->id))
00298         continue;
00299 
00300       live_range = Set_add (live_range, oper->id);
00301 
00302       R_determine_reserved_registers (&reserved_resource, &cres, NULL, vreg);
00303 
00304       /* see if there is a register available to hold the live range */
00305       free_register = R_find_free_register (vreg, reserved_resource, 1);
00306       reserved_resource = Set_dispose (reserved_resource);
00307 
00308       if (free_register == -1)
00309         {
00310           if (Set_size (live_range) > 1)
00311             live_range = Set_delete (live_range, oper->id);
00312           break;
00313         }
00314     }
00315 #if 0
00316   fprintf (stdout, "\t-> Creating new vreg #%d\n", vreg->index);
00317   fprintf (stdout, "\t---> Contains instr: ");
00318   Set_print (stdout, "", live_range);
00319   fprintf (stdout, "\n");
00320 #endif
00321   vreg->flags = R_SPILLED | R_INSTR_SPLIT;
00322   vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
00323   vreg->live_range = Set_dispose (vreg->live_range);
00324   vreg->ref_instr = vreg->live_range = Set_copy (live_range);
00325 
00326   /* if we are to use "invariant" priorities, use register id */
00327   /* rather than profile/static based priority                */
00328 
00329   max_weight = (!use_invariant) ? vreg->priority : (double) vreg->index;
00330 
00331   /* determine the interferences of the new live range */
00332 
00333   for (arc = iarcs; arc; arc = arc->next)
00334     {
00335       double arc_weight = (!use_invariant) ? arc->lr->priority : 
00336         (double) arc->lr->index;
00337 
00338       if (arc_weight > max_weight)
00339         max_weight = arc_weight;
00340 
00341       if (Set_intersect_empty (vreg->live_range, arc->lr->live_range))
00342         R_remove_interference (arc->lr, vreg);
00343       else
00344         R_add_interference_arc (arc->lr, vreg);
00345     }
00346   /* assign new priority */
00347   vreg->priority = max_weight + 1.0;
00348 
00349   new_id = R_find_free_vreg ();
00350   new_vreg = R_add_register (new_id, ctype, 0.0, 0);
00351   new_vreg->flags |= (R_SPILLED | R_INSTR_SPLIT);
00352   new_vreg->ref_instr = new_vreg->live_range =
00353     Set_subtract (ref_instr, live_range);
00354 
00355   new_vreg->illegal_reg = Set_copy (vreg->illegal_reg);
00356   new_vreg->constraints = Set_copy (vreg->constraints);
00357 
00358   /* renumber the instructions virtual registers */
00359   n = Set_2array (new_vreg->ref_instr, nbor);
00360   for (k = 0; k < n; k++)
00361     {
00362       L_Oper *oper = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl, nbor[k]);
00363       R_renumber_oper_vreg (oper, vreg->index, new_id);
00364     }
00365 
00366   new_vreg->spill_loc = vreg->spill_loc;
00367   new_vreg->pvreg = ((vreg->pvreg == NULL) ? vreg : vreg->pvreg);
00368 
00369   new_vreg->caller_benefit = 1;
00370   new_vreg->callee_benefit = 0;
00371   new_vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
00372 #if 0
00373   fprintf (stdout, "\t-> Creating new vreg #%d\n", new_id);
00374   fprintf (stdout, "\t---> Contains instr: ");
00375   Set_print (stdout, "", new_vreg->ref_instr);
00376   fprintf (stdout, "\n");
00377 #endif
00378   /* determine the interferences of the new live range */
00379 
00380  for (arc = iarcs; arc; arc = next_arc)
00381     {
00382       next_arc = arc->next;
00383 
00384       if (!Set_intersect_empty (new_vreg->live_range, 
00385                                 arc->lr->live_range))
00386         {
00387           R_add_interference_arc (new_vreg, arc->lr);
00388           R_add_interference_arc (arc->lr, new_vreg);
00389         }
00390 
00391       L_free (R_alloc_interference_arc, arc);
00392     }
00393   new_vreg->priority = max_weight + 1.0;
00394 
00395   Push_Top (vreg_stack, new_vreg);
00396 
00397   Set_dispose (ref_instr);
00398   Set_dispose (live_range);
00399   Set_dispose (reserved_resource);
00400   return;
00401 }
00402 
00403 extern int R_Prevent_MCB_Preload_Spills;
00404 
00405 void
00406 R_handle_unallocatable_vreg (L_Func * fn, R_Reg * vreg, Stack * vreg_stack)
00407 {
00408   R_Arc *arc, *next_arc, *prev_arc;
00409   double max_weight;
00410   L_Region_Regmap *regmap;
00411   int use_invariant = R_Invariant_Vreg_Priorities;
00412 
00413   /* A live range at this point may be at one of these levels: */
00414   /*    1) Not yet spilled and thus not split                  */
00415   /*    2) spilled                                             */
00416   /*    3) split at the cb level                               */
00417   /*    4) split at the instruction level                      */
00418   /*  NOTE: Predicates represent a special case, I'm not       */
00419   /*        allowed to alter the live range of a predicate     */
00420   /*        since predicate register may not be reused with    */
00421   /*        cb.  Thus if a spilled predicate register cannot   */
00422   /*        be allocated, I will punt.                         */
00423   /* NOTE2: I'm not sure how demotion will tie into all of this */
00424 
00425   if (R_Prevent_MCB_Preload_Spills && (vreg->flags & R_MCB_PRELOAD))
00426     {
00427       if (vreg->priority == 1.79e+308)
00428         L_punt ("Register Allocation: Unable to allocate mcb preload %d\n",
00429                 vreg->index);
00430 
00431       vreg->priority = (use_invariant == 0) ? 1.78e+308 : 
00432         (double) L_fn->max_reg_id + 1.0;
00433 
00434       return;
00435     }
00436 
00437   if (vreg->flags & R_SPILLED)
00438     {
00439       /* previously spilled and cb split, case 3) */
00440       if (vreg->flags & R_CB_SPLIT)
00441         {
00442           R_isplit_spilled_live_range (fn, vreg, vreg_stack);
00443         }
00444       /* previously spilled and instruction split, case 4) */
00445       else if (vreg->flags & R_INSTR_SPLIT)
00446         {
00447           if (Set_size (vreg->live_range) == 1)
00448             L_punt ("R_handle_unallocatable_vreg: "
00449                     "INSUFFICIENT REGISTERS!!!!\n",
00450                     vreg->index);
00451           R_isplit_spilled_live_range (fn, vreg, vreg_stack);
00452         }
00453       else
00454         {
00455           /* previously spilled, but not yet split, case 2) */
00456           R_cbsplit_spilled_live_range (fn, vreg, vreg_stack);
00457         }
00458     }
00459   else
00460     {
00461       /* previously unspilled live range, case 1) */
00462       prev_arc = NULL;
00463 
00464       /* if we are to use "invariant" priorities, use register id */
00465       /* rather than profile/static based priority            */
00466 
00467       max_weight = (!use_invariant) ? vreg->priority : 
00468         (double) vreg->index;
00469 
00470       /* modify interference graph to reflect spilling of vreg */
00471       for (arc = vreg->interfere; arc; arc = next_arc)
00472         {
00473           double arc_weight = (!use_invariant) ? arc->lr->priority :
00474             (double) arc->lr->index;
00475 
00476           if (arc_weight > max_weight)
00477             max_weight = arc_weight;
00478 
00479           next_arc = arc->next;
00480 
00481           if (Set_intersect_empty (vreg->ref_instr, arc->lr->live_range))
00482             {
00483               /* these two live ranges no longer interfere */
00484               R_remove_interference (arc->lr, vreg);
00485 
00486               if (prev_arc)
00487                 prev_arc->next = next_arc;
00488               else              /* arc = first arc */
00489                 vreg->interfere = next_arc;
00490 
00491               L_free (R_alloc_interference_arc, arc);
00492             }
00493           else
00494             {
00495               prev_arc = ((arc != vreg->interfere) && prev_arc) ? 
00496                 prev_arc->next : arc;
00497             }
00498         }
00499 
00500       vreg->flags |= R_SPILLED;
00501 
00502       regmap = L_find_region_regmap (R_Region, vreg->index);
00503       if (regmap && (regmap->spill_loc != -1))
00504         vreg->spill_loc = regmap->spill_loc;
00505       else
00506         vreg->spill_loc = R_spill_loc (vreg->type);
00507 
00508       /* new live range for spilled vreg */
00509       Set_dispose (vreg->live_range);
00510       vreg->live_range = vreg->ref_instr;
00511 
00512       /* new caller/callee benefits */
00513       vreg->caller_benefit = 1;
00514       vreg->callee_benefit = 0;
00515       vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
00516 
00517       /* new priority */
00518       vreg->priority = max_weight + 1.0;
00519     }
00520   return;
00521 }
00522 
00523 /*===========================================================================
00524  *
00525  *      Func :  R_insert_spill_code_before()
00526  *              R_insert_spill_code_after()
00527  *      Desc :  Inserts the linked list of of L_Oper's <spill> 
00528  *              before(after) <oper> in cb <cb> and returns a
00529  *              count of the number of L_Oper's in the <spill> 
00530  *              list.
00531  *      Input:  L_Cb   *cb    - insertion cb
00532  *              L_Oper *oper  - insertion point
00533  *              L_Oper *spill - list of oper's to insert
00534  *      Output: none
00535  *
00536  *      Side Effects:
00537  *
00538  *===========================================================================*/
00539 int
00540 R_insert_spill_code_before (L_Cb * cb, L_Oper * oper, L_Oper * spill)
00541 {
00542   int cnt = 0;
00543   L_Oper *tmp;
00544   L_Oper *cur = spill;
00545 
00546   while (cur != NULL)
00547     {
00548       tmp = cur->next_op;
00549       L_insert_oper_before (cb, oper, cur);
00550       cnt++;
00551       cur = tmp;
00552     }
00553   return (cnt);
00554 }
00555 
00556 int
00557 R_insert_spill_code_after (L_Cb * cb, L_Oper * oper, L_Oper * spill)
00558 {
00559   int cnt = 0;
00560   L_Oper *tmp, *prev = oper, *cur = spill;
00561 
00562   while (cur)
00563     {
00564       tmp = cur->next_op;
00565       L_insert_oper_after (cb, prev, cur);
00566       cnt++;
00567       prev = cur;
00568       cur = tmp;
00569     }
00570   return (cnt);
00571 }
00572 
00573 static int
00574 R_in_physical_register (int vreg_id, int base, int vreg_type, int vreg_class)
00575 {
00576   int i;
00577   R_Physical_Bank *bank = R_bank + vreg_type + vreg_class;
00578 
00579   for (i = base; i < base + bank->reg_size; i++)
00580     if (R_register_contents[i] != vreg_id)
00581       return (0);
00582 
00583   return (1);
00584 }
00585 
00586 static void
00587 R_put_in_physical_register (int vreg_id, int base, int vreg_type,
00588                             int vreg_class)
00589 {
00590   int i;
00591   R_Physical_Bank *bank = R_bank + vreg_type + vreg_class;
00592 
00593   for (i = base; i < base + bank->reg_size; i++)
00594     R_register_contents[i] = vreg_id;
00595 }
00596 
00597 static int
00598 R_same_register (R_Reg * vreg1, R_Reg * vreg2)
00599 {
00600   if (R_bank[vreg1->type + vreg1->rclass].reg_size >
00601       R_bank[vreg2->type + vreg2->rclass].reg_size)
00602     {
00603       if (vreg1->base_index ==
00604           (vreg2->base_index & R_bank[vreg1->type + vreg1->rclass].mask))
00605         return (1);
00606     }
00607   else
00608     {
00609       if ((vreg1->base_index & R_bank[vreg2->type + vreg2->rclass].mask) ==
00610           vreg2->base_index)
00611         return (1);
00612     }
00613   return (0);
00614 }
00615 
00616 static int
00617 R_register_spill_is_required (L_Cb * cb, L_Oper * oper, R_Reg * vreg)
00618 {
00619   int index;
00620   L_Oper *cur_oper;
00621 
00622   if (!R_Register_Allocation)
00623     return (1);
00624 
00625   /* If the virtual register's live range has been split */
00626   /* use the vreg->index of its parent                       */
00627 
00628   index = ((vreg->flags & (R_CB_SPLIT | R_INSTR_SPLIT)) && vreg->pvreg) ? 
00629     vreg->pvreg->index : vreg->index;
00630 
00631   if (L_in_cb_OUT_set_reg (cb, index))
00632     return (1);
00633 
00634   for (cur_oper = oper->next_op; cur_oper; cur_oper = cur_oper->next_op)
00635     {
00636       int i;
00637       L_Operand *opd;
00638       L_Attr *attr;
00639 
00640       if (cur_oper->id > R_n_oper)
00641         continue;
00642 
00643       if (!L_in_oper_IN_set_reg (cur_oper, index))
00644         break;
00645 
00646       if (cur_oper->opc == Lop_JSR || cur_oper->opc == Lop_JSR_FS)
00647         return (1);
00648 
00649       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00650         if ((opd = cur_oper->dest[i]) && (L_is_reg (opd)))
00651           {
00652             /* If the virtual registers are the same, then no spill */
00653             /* is required, since the variable is being redefined   */
00654             /* Otherwise, I don't need to spill it until a defined  */
00655             /* virtual register uses the same physical register     */
00656 
00657             if (opd->value.r == vreg->index)
00658               return (0);
00659             else if (R_same_register (VREG (opd->value.r), vreg))
00660               return (1);
00661           }
00662       for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
00663         if ((opd = cur_oper->src[i]) && (L_is_reg (opd)))
00664           {
00665             if (R_same_register (VREG (opd->value.r), vreg) &&
00666                 (opd->value.r != vreg->index))
00667               return (1);
00668           }
00669       /* EMN: Extended source support */
00670       if ((oper->opc == Lop_CHECK) && 
00671           (attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "src")))
00672         {
00673           for (i = 0; i < attr->max_field; i++)
00674             {
00675               if (!(opd = attr->field[i]))
00676                 continue;
00677               if ((opd = cur_oper->src[i]) && (L_is_reg (opd)) &&
00678                   R_same_register (VREG (opd->value.r), vreg) &&
00679                   (opd->value.r != vreg->index))
00680                 return (1);
00681             }
00682         }
00683     }
00684   return (0);
00685 }
00686 
00687 static int
00688 R_max_bank_offset (void)
00689 {
00690   int i, offset, max = 0;
00691   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
00692 
00693   for (i = 0; i < R_MAX_BANK; i++)
00694     {
00695       bank = R_bank + i;
00696       if (!bank->defined)
00697         continue;
00698 
00699       offset = bank->base_index + bank->num_reg * bank->reg_size;
00700       if (offset > max)
00701         max = offset;
00702     }
00703   return (max);
00704 }
00705 
00706 /*===========================================================================
00707  *
00708  *      Func :  R_insert_spill_fill_code()
00709  *      Desc :  Inserts required load/store instructions to handle spilled
00710  *              virtual registers. Load instructions are not inserted if the
00711  *              desired value is already guaranteed to be in a spill register 
00712  *      Input:  L_Func *fn      - current function 
00713  *      Output: none
00714  *
00715  *      Side Effects:  if DEBUG_PRINT_SPILL_PRECENTAGES is defined then
00716  *                     <total_instruction_weight> and <total_spill_weight>
00717  *                     are also calculated. 
00718  *
00719  *===========================================================================*/
00720 void
00721 R_insert_spill_fill_code (L_Region * region)
00722 {
00723   int i, k;
00724   L_Oper *oper, *save_oper;
00725   L_Cb *cur_cb;
00726   int n_instr, max_offset, hyperblock;
00727   L_Oper *spill_instr;
00728   L_Region_Member *mbr;
00729   L_Attr *attr;
00730 
00731   double instruction_weight = 0.0;
00732   double spill_weight = 0.0;
00733 
00734   max_offset = R_max_bank_offset ();
00735   R_register_contents = (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) * (max_offset + 1));
00736 
00737   for (mbr = region->member_cbs; mbr != NULL; mbr = mbr->next_member)
00738     {
00739       cur_cb = mbr->cb;
00740 
00741       /* insert spill code -> load instructions in a forward pass over
00742          the cb */
00743 
00744       hyperblock = L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cur_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
00745 
00746       for (k = 0; k < max_offset + 1; k++)
00747         R_register_contents[k] = -1;
00748 
00749       for (oper = cur_cb->first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
00750         {
00751           R_Reg *vreg;
00752           L_Oper *next_oper;
00753           int vrid;
00754 
00755           instruction_weight += oper->weight;
00756 
00757           /* guard predicate */
00758 
00759           {
00760             L_Operand *pred = oper->pred[0];
00761             if (pred && L_is_reg (pred))
00762               {
00763                 vrid = pred->value.r;
00764                 vreg = VREG (vrid);
00765                 if ((vreg->flags & R_SPILLED) &&
00766                     (hyperblock ||
00767                      !R_in_physical_register(vrid, vreg->base_index, 
00768                                              vreg->type, vreg->rclass)))
00769                   {
00770                     spill_instr = 
00771                       O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
00772                                   R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass(vreg->rclass),
00773                                   pred, vreg->spill_loc, NULL,
00774                                   R_SPILL_CODE);
00775                         
00776                     n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_before (cur_cb, oper,
00777                                                           spill_instr);
00778                         
00779                     R_register_contents[vreg->base_index] = vrid;
00780                         
00781                     spill_weight += (oper->weight * n_instr);
00782                   }
00783 
00784                 /* save virtual predicate of jsr */
00785                 if (L_general_subroutine_call_opcode (oper))
00786                   {
00787                     L_Attr *new_attr = L_new_attr ("vpred", 1);
00788                     L_set_int_attr_field (new_attr, 0, vrid);
00789                     oper->attr = L_concat_attr (oper->attr, new_attr);
00790                   }
00791                 
00792                 pred->value.r = vreg->phys_reg;
00793               }
00794           }
00795 
00796           /* src operands */
00797 
00798           for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
00799             {
00800               L_Operand *src = oper->src[i];
00801               if (!src || !L_is_reg (src))
00802                 continue;
00803 
00804               vrid = src->value.r;
00805               vreg = VREG (vrid);
00806               if ((vreg->flags & R_SPILLED) &&
00807                   (hyperblock ||
00808                    !R_in_physical_register (vrid, vreg->base_index, 
00809                                             vreg->type, vreg->rclass)))
00810                 {
00811                   spill_instr = 
00812                     O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
00813                                 R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass (vreg->rclass),
00814                                 src, vreg->spill_loc, oper->pred,
00815                                 R_SPILL_CODE);
00816                           
00817                   n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_before (cur_cb, oper,
00818                                                         spill_instr);
00819 
00820                   R_register_contents[vreg->base_index] = vrid;
00821 
00822                   spill_weight += (oper->weight * n_instr);
00823                   ld_wgt += (oper->weight * n_instr);
00824                   ld_cnt += 1;
00825                 }
00826 
00827               if (vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLER ||
00828                   vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLEE)
00829                 L_assign_type_general_macro (src);
00830 
00831               src->value.r = vreg->phys_reg;
00832             }
00833 
00834           /* EMN: Extended source support */
00835 
00836           if (oper->opc == Lop_CHECK && 
00837               (attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "src")))
00838             {
00839               for (i = 0; i < attr->max_field; i++)
00840                 {
00841                   L_Operand *src = attr->field[i];
00842                   if (!src || !L_is_reg (src))
00843                     continue;
00844 
00845                   vrid = src->value.r;
00846                   vreg = VREG (vrid);
00847                   if ((vreg->flags & R_SPILLED) &&
00848                       (hyperblock ||
00849                        !R_in_physical_register (vrid, vreg->base_index, 
00850                                                 vreg->type, vreg->rclass)))
00851                     {
00852                       spill_instr =
00853                         (L_Oper *) O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
00854                                                R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass
00855                                                (vreg->rclass), src,
00856                                                vreg->spill_loc,
00857                                                oper->pred,
00858                                                R_SPILL_CODE);
00859 
00860                       n_instr = 
00861                         R_insert_spill_code_before (cur_cb, oper,
00862                                                     spill_instr);
00863                               
00864                       R_register_contents[vreg->base_index] = vrid;
00865 
00866                       spill_weight += (oper->weight * n_instr);
00867                       ld_wgt += (oper->weight * n_instr);
00868                       ld_cnt += 1;
00869                     }
00870 
00871                   if (vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLER ||
00872                       vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLEE)
00873                     L_assign_type_general_macro (src);
00874 
00875                   src->value.r = vreg->phys_reg;
00876                 }
00877             }
00878 
00879           /* dest operands */
00880 
00881           save_oper = NULL;
00882           for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00883             {
00884               L_Operand *dest = oper->dest[i];
00885               if (!dest || !L_is_reg (dest))
00886                 continue;
00887 
00888               vrid = dest->value.r;
00889               vreg = VREG (vrid);
00890               R_put_in_physical_register (vrid, vreg->base_index,
00891                                           vreg->type, vreg->rclass);
00892               if ((vreg->flags & R_SPILLED) &&
00893                   (hyperblock ||
00894                    R_register_spill_is_required (cur_cb, oper, vreg)))
00895                 {
00896                   spill_instr =
00897                     O_spill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
00898                                  R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass (vreg->rclass), 
00899                                  dest, vreg->spill_loc, oper->pred,
00900                                  R_SPILL_CODE);
00901                   next_oper = spill_instr;
00902                   while (next_oper->next_op)
00903                     next_oper = next_oper->next_op;
00904 
00905                   n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_after (cur_cb, oper, 
00906                                                        spill_instr);
00907 
00908                   if (!save_oper)
00909                     save_oper = next_oper;
00910 
00911                   spill_weight += n_instr * oper->weight;
00912                   st_wgt += n_instr * oper->weight;
00913                   st_cnt += n_instr;
00914                 }
00915 
00916               if (vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLER || 
00917                   vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLEE)
00918                 L_assign_type_general_macro (dest);
00919 
00920               dest->value.r = vreg->phys_reg;
00921             }
00922 
00923           if (save_oper)
00924             oper = save_oper;
00925           /* nullify the current register contents for subroutine calls */
00926           if (L_general_subroutine_call_opcode (oper))
00927             for (k = 0; k < max_offset + 1; k++)
00928               R_register_contents[k] = -1;
00929         }
00930     }
00931 
00932   total_instruction_weight += instruction_weight;
00933   total_spill_weight += spill_weight;
00934 
00935   free (R_register_contents);
00936   return;
00937 }
00938 
00939 int
00940 R_jsr_defines_vreg (L_Oper * jsr, int vreg_id)
00941 {
00942   int i;
00943   L_Operand *dst;
00944 
00945   for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00946     {
00947       if ((dst = jsr->dest[i]) == NULL)
00948         continue;
00949 
00950       if (L_is_reg (dst) && (dst->value.r == vreg_id))
00951         return (1);
00952     }
00953   return (0);
00954 }
00955 
00956 #if 1
00957 /* TEMPO */
00958 #include <machine/m_tahoe.h>
00959 
00960 static L_Oper *
00961 O_pred_save_operation (L_Operand *pred, L_Operand *dest)
00962 {
00963   L_Oper *mov_oper;
00964 
00965   mov_oper = L_create_new_op (Lop_MOV);
00966   mov_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_MOV_FRPR;
00967   mov_oper->src[0] = L_new_macro_operand (TAHOE_PRED_BLK_REG, L_CTYPE_LLONG,
00968                                           L_PTYPE_NULL);
00969   mov_oper->dest[0] = dest;
00970   mov_oper->pred[0] = pred;
00971   return (mov_oper);
00972 }
00973 
00974 static L_Oper *
00975 O_pred_restore_operation (L_Operand *pred, L_Operand *src, ITintmax mask)
00976 {
00977   L_Oper *mov_oper;
00978 
00979   mov_oper = L_create_new_op (Lop_MOV);
00980   mov_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_MOV_TOPR;
00981   mov_oper->src[0] = src;
00982   mov_oper->src[1] = L_new_gen_int_operand (mask);
00983   mov_oper->dest[0] = L_new_macro_operand (TAHOE_PRED_BLK_REG, L_CTYPE_LLONG,
00984                                            L_PTYPE_NULL);
00985   mov_oper->pred[0] = pred;
00986   return (mov_oper);
00987 }
00988 
00989 #endif
00990 
00999 static int
01000 R_last_jsr_in_cb (L_Oper *jsr)
01001 {
01002   L_Oper *t;
01003 
01004   for (t = jsr->next_op; t; t = t->next_op)
01005     if (L_subroutine_call_opcode (t))
01006       return (0);
01007 
01008   return (1);
01009 }
01010 
01032 static int
01033 R_used_between_jsrs (int vreg_id, L_Oper *jsr1, L_Oper *jsr2)
01034 {
01035   L_Oper *cur_oper;
01036   L_Operand *cur_operand;
01037   int i;
01038 
01039   for (cur_oper = jsr1->next_op; cur_oper != jsr2;
01040        cur_oper = cur_oper->next_op)
01041     {
01042       for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
01043         {
01044           if ((cur_operand = cur_oper->src[i]) == NULL)
01045             continue;
01046 
01047           if (L_is_reg (cur_operand) && (cur_operand->value.r == vreg_id))
01048             return (1);
01049         }
01050 
01051       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
01052         {
01053           if ((cur_operand = cur_oper->dest[i]) == NULL)
01054             continue;
01055 
01056           if (L_is_reg (cur_operand) && (cur_operand->value.r == vreg_id))
01057             return (1);
01058         }
01059     }
01060 
01061   return (0);
01062 }
01063 
01064 /*===========================================================================
01065  *
01066  *      Func :  R_insert_jsr_spill_fill_code()
01067  *      Desc :  Inserts required load/store instructions to handle spilling
01068  *              caller saved registers around subroutine calls.
01069  *      Input:  L_Func *fn      - current function
01070  *      Output: none
01071  *
01072  *      Side Effects:  if DEBUG_PRINT_SPILL_PRECENTAGES is defined then
01073  *                     <total_caller_weight> is also calculated.
01074  *
01075  *===========================================================================*/
01076 int
01077 R_insert_jsr_spill_fill_code (L_Func * fn, int *int_jsr_swap_space,
01078                               int *fp_jsr_swap_space, int *pred_jsr_swap_space)
01079 {
01080   int i, ltype, n_jsr;
01081   L_Cb **jsr_cb_array = NULL;
01082   int pred_swap_stack = 0, int_swap_stack = 0, fp_swap_stack = 0;
01083   Set *jsr_save_reg = NULL;
01084   L_Attr *attr;
01085   L_Oper *spill_instr, *oper, *next_jsr;
01086   R_Reg *vreg;
01087   L_Operand *operand = L_new_register_operand (0, L_CTYPE_VOID, L_PTYPE_NULL);
01088 
01089   double caller_weight = 0.0;
01090 
01091   L_Cb *cur_jsr_cb;
01092 
01093   if ((n_jsr = List_size (R_jsr_list)))
01094     {
01095       jsr_save_reg = CALLOC (Set, n_jsr);
01096       jsr_cb_array = (L_Cb **) malloc (sizeof (L_Cb) * n_jsr);
01097     }
01098 
01099   /* Find the cb for each jsr and insert it in jsr_cb_list. */
01100   List_start (R_jsr_list);
01101   i = 0;
01102   while ((oper = (L_Oper *)List_next (R_jsr_list)))
01103     {
01104       if (!(cur_jsr_cb = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_cb (fn->oper_hash_tbl,
01105                                                   oper->id)))
01106         L_punt ("r_regspill.c:R_insert_jsr_spill_fill_code:%d Could not find "
01107                 "CB for oper %d", __LINE__, oper->id);
01108       
01109       jsr_cb_array[i] = cur_jsr_cb;
01110       i++;
01111     }
01112 
01113   /* find all the caller-saved registers that need to be saved */
01114   /* 12/10/04 REK Note that no vregs with R_SPILLED set will be added
01115    *              to the list to save for a jsr.  It should be safe to
01116    *              use this field for our purposes as long as we clear it
01117    *              before the vreg escapes this function. */
01118   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
01119     {
01120       if (vreg->flags & R_SPILLED)
01121         continue;
01122 
01123       if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_MACRO ||
01124           vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY)
01125         continue;
01126 
01127       if (!(vreg->rclass == R_CALLER || vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLER))
01128         continue;
01129 
01130       List_start (R_jsr_list);
01131       i = 0;
01132       while ((oper = (L_Oper *)List_next (R_jsr_list)))
01133         {
01134           if (oper->opc == Lop_JSR_ND)
01135             continue;
01136 
01137           if (Set_in (vreg->live_range, oper->id) &&
01138               L_in_oper_IN_set_reg (oper, vreg->index) &&
01139               L_in_oper_OUT_set_reg (jsr_cb_array[i], oper, vreg->index,
01140                                      BOTH_PATHS) &&
01141               !R_jsr_defines_vreg (oper, vreg->phys_reg))
01142             jsr_save_reg[i] = Set_add (jsr_save_reg[i], vreg->index);
01143 
01144           i++;
01145         }
01146     }
01147 
01148   /* determine largest amount of space required to save these registers */
01149   /* and insert the required load and store instructions                */
01150   List_start (R_jsr_list);
01151   next_jsr = (L_Oper *)List_next (R_jsr_list);
01152   i = 0;
01153   while ((oper = next_jsr))
01154     {
01155       int n_instr, j, *reg_array, n_reg, pred_loc = 0;
01156       Set predicates = NULL, not_spilled_for_next_jsr = NULL;
01157 
01158       if ((next_jsr = (L_Oper *)List_next (R_jsr_list)))
01159         not_spilled_for_next_jsr = Set_subtract (jsr_save_reg[i],
01160                                                  jsr_save_reg[i + 1]);
01161 
01162       reg_array = MALLOC (int, Set_size (jsr_save_reg[i]));
01163       n_reg = Set_2array (jsr_save_reg[i], reg_array);
01164 
01165       pred_swap_stack = pred_spill_stack;
01166       int_swap_stack = int_spill_stack;
01167       fp_swap_stack = fp_spill_stack;
01168 
01169       if ((attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "vpred")))
01170         {
01171           pred_loc = int_swap_stack;
01172           if (M_arch != M_TAHOE)
01173             {
01174               int_swap_stack += 4;
01175             }
01176           else
01177             {
01178               int_swap_stack += 8;
01179               pred_swap_stack += 1;
01180             }
01181         }
01182 
01183       for (j = 0; j < n_reg; j++)
01184         {
01185           int spill_offset;
01186 
01187           vreg = VREG (reg_array[j]);
01188 
01189           if ((M_arch == M_TAHOE) && (vreg->type == R_PREDICATE))
01190             {
01191               predicates = Set_add (predicates, reg_array[j]);
01192               continue;
01193             }
01194 
01195           /* ensure alignment of spills */
01196 
01197           if ((vreg->type == R_DOUBLE) || (vreg->type == R_FLOAT))
01198             {
01199               if (M_arch == M_TAHOE)
01200                 {
01201                   if (fp_swap_stack % 16)
01202                     fp_swap_stack += (16 - (fp_swap_stack % 16));
01203                 }
01204               else
01205                 {
01206                   int swap_stack = int_swap_stack + fp_swap_stack;
01207                   if (swap_stack % 8)
01208                     fp_swap_stack += (8 - (swap_stack % 8));
01209                 }
01210             }
01211 
01212           /* save location of jsr predicate and don't insert the load */
01213           if (attr && ((int) attr->field[0]->value.i == vreg->index))
01214             {
01215               /*
01216                  pred_loc = swap_stack;
01217                */
01218               ;
01219             }
01220           else
01221             {
01222               /* insert load after oper, from swap_loc */
01223               /* to vreg->base_index                           */
01224               ltype = R_conv_type_to_Ltype (vreg->type);
01225 
01226               L_assign_ctype (operand, ltype);
01227 
01228               /* If we're trying to minimize spills and fills, a register
01229                * needs a spill offset that is valid across multiple jsrs.
01230                * We compute an unique offset for each vreg.  Note that this
01231                * may use more swap space than the old method. */
01232               if (R_Minimize_Spill_Fill)
01233                 {
01234                   if (vreg->spill_loc == -1)
01235                     vreg->spill_loc = R_spill_loc (vreg->type);
01236 
01237                   spill_offset = vreg->spill_loc;
01238                 }
01239               else
01240                 {
01241                   /* Default to the old behavior.  Live registers are
01242                    * spilled starting at int_spill_stack, but do not have
01243                    * necessarily have constant spill offsets across jsrs.
01244                    * This potentially uses less spill space, but means
01245                    * a spill is not valid across more than one jsr. */
01246                   if (M_arch == M_TAHOE)
01247                     {
01248                       if ((vreg->type == R_DOUBLE) || (vreg->type == R_FLOAT))
01249                         spill_offset = fp_swap_stack;
01250                       else if ((vreg->type == R_PREDICATE))
01251                         spill_offset = pred_swap_stack;
01252                       else
01253                         spill_offset = int_swap_stack;              
01254                     }
01255                   else
01256                     {
01257                       spill_offset = int_swap_stack + fp_swap_stack;
01258                     }
01259                 }
01260 
01261               /* Spill the register
01262                *
01263                * 12/10/04 REK I use the R_SPILLED flag here to determine if
01264                *              a vreg is still spilled from a previous jsr.
01265                *              I believe this to safe (search backward for
01266                *              '12/10/04 REK' to find my previous note) since
01267                *              the flag will be cleared before the vreg leaves
01268                *              this function. */
01269               if ((R_Minimize_Spill_Fill == 0) || !(vreg->flags & R_SPILLED))
01270                 {
01271                   vreg->flags |= R_SPILLED;
01272 
01273                   if (vreg->spill_loc == -1)
01274                     vreg->spill_loc = R_spill_loc (vreg->type);
01275                   
01276                   /* If we're minimizing spills and fills, we do not
01277                    * apply the jsr's predicate to the spill code.  This
01278                    * gives us the opportunity to elimininate the
01279                    * corresponding fill and maintain correctness if
01280                    * the next jsr is not predicated. */
01281                   spill_instr = \
01282                     O_spill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
01283                                  R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass(vreg->rclass),
01284                                  operand, spill_offset,
01285                                  R_Minimize_Spill_Fill == 0 ? oper->pred : \
01286                                                               NULL,
01287                                  R_JSR_SAVE_CODE);
01288                   
01289                   n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_before (jsr_cb_array[i], oper,
01290                                                         spill_instr);
01291                   
01292                   caller_weight += n_instr * oper->weight;
01293                   st_wgt += n_instr * oper->weight;
01294                   st_cnt += n_instr;
01295                 }
01296 
01297               /* Fill the register
01298                *
01299                * If we're minimizing spills and fills, we have to fill
01300                * this register if
01301                * -The current jsr is the last jsr in the cb, or
01302                * -The register is used before the next jsr, or
01303                * -There is a branch before the next jsr, or
01304                * -The register does not get spilled for the next jsr.
01305                *
01306                * If none of these apply, we eliminate this fill and the
01307                * corresponding spill. */
01308               if ((R_Minimize_Spill_Fill == 0) || 
01309                   R_last_jsr_in_cb (oper) ||
01310                   R_used_between_jsrs (vreg->phys_reg, oper, next_jsr) ||
01311                   !(L_no_br_between (oper, next_jsr)) ||
01312                   Set_in (not_spilled_for_next_jsr, vreg->index))
01313                 {
01314                   vreg->flags &= ~R_SPILLED;
01315 
01316                   if (vreg->spill_loc == -1)
01317                     L_punt ("r_regspill.c:R_insert_jsr_spill_fill_code:%d "
01318                             "Attempting to fill\nregister with undefined "
01319                             "location", __LINE__); 
01320                   
01321                   /* If we're minimizing spills and fills, we do not
01322                    * apply the jsr's predicate to the fill code.  The
01323                    * spill may have happened several jsrs ago for a
01324                    * non-predicated jsr. */
01325                   spill_instr = \
01326                     O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
01327                                 R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass (vreg->rclass),
01328                                 operand, spill_offset,
01329                                 R_Minimize_Spill_Fill == 0 ? oper->pred : NULL,
01330                                 R_JSR_SAVE_CODE);
01331                   
01332                   n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_after (jsr_cb_array[i], oper,
01333                                                        spill_instr);
01334                   
01335                   caller_weight += n_instr * oper->weight;
01336                   ld_wgt += n_instr * oper->weight;
01337                   ld_cnt += n_instr;
01338                 }
01339             }
01340 
01341           /* 12/10/04 REK Adjusting the swap stack if only necessary if we're
01342            *              using the old scheme where registers are spilled
01343            *              at a new location for each jsr.  When minimizing,
01344            *              each register gets a unique location from
01345            *              R_spill_loc(). */
01346           if (R_Minimize_Spill_Fill == 0)
01347             {
01348               if (M_arch == M_TAHOE)
01349                 {
01350                   switch (vreg->type)
01351                     {
01352                     case R_INT:
01353                     case R_BTR:
01354                       int_swap_stack += 8;
01355                       break;
01356                     case R_FLOAT:
01357                     case R_DOUBLE:
01358                       fp_swap_stack += 16;
01359                       break;
01360                     case R_PREDICATE:
01361                       pred_swap_stack += 1;
01362                       break;
01363                     case R_QUAD:
01364                       fprintf (stderr, "Unable to spill quad or predicate.\n");
01365                     default:
01366                       L_punt ("R_register_allocation(jsr): invalid register "
01367                               "type");
01368                     }
01369                 }
01370               else
01371                 {
01372                   switch (vreg->type)
01373                     {
01374                     case R_INT:
01375                     case R_PREDICATE:
01376                     case R_FLOAT:
01377                     case R_BTR:
01378                     case R_POINTER:
01379                       int_swap_stack += 4;
01380                       break;
01381                     case R_DOUBLE:
01382                       int_swap_stack += 8;
01383                       break;
01384                     case R_QUAD:
01385                     default:
01386                       L_punt ("R_register_allocation(jsr): invalid register "
01387                               "type");
01388                     }
01389                 }
01390             }
01391         }
01392       /* if the jsr was predicated, 
01393          insert an unpredicated load of jsr predicate */
01394       
01395       /* REH 5/11/95 - Resulted in unpredicated spills/loads of the 
01396          jsr's predicate even when it was callee-saved
01397          if ( attr  && (n_reg > 0))  {
01398        */
01399 
01400       if (attr && Set_in (jsr_save_reg[i], (int) attr->field[0]->value.i))
01401         {
01402           int stack_loc;
01403 
01404           vreg = VREG ((int) attr->field[0]->value.i);
01405 
01406           if (vreg->flags & R_SPILLED)
01407             stack_loc = vreg->spill_loc;
01408           else
01409             stack_loc = pred_loc;
01410           /* Let the code generator worry about proper predication */
01411           /* of the required spill instructions                    */
01412           L_assign_ctype (operand, L_CTYPE_PREDICATE);
01413           spill_instr = O_spill_reg (vreg->phys_reg, L_OPERAND_REGISTER,
01414                                      operand, stack_loc,
01415                                      NULL, R_JSR_SAVE_CODE);
01416 
01417           n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_before (jsr_cb_array[i], oper,
01418                                                 spill_instr);     
01419 
01420           caller_weight += n_instr * oper->weight;
01421           st_wgt += n_instr * oper->weight;
01422           st_cnt += n_instr;
01423 
01424           L_assign_ctype (operand, L_CTYPE_PREDICATE);
01425           spill_instr = O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg, L_OPERAND_REGISTER,
01426                                     operand, stack_loc,
01427                                     NULL, R_JSR_SAVE_CODE);
01428 
01429           n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_after (jsr_cb_array[i], oper,
01430                                                spill_instr);
01431 
01432           caller_weight += n_instr * oper->weight;
01433           ld_wgt += n_instr * oper->weight;
01434           ld_cnt += n_instr;
01435         }
01436 
01437       if ((M_arch == M_TAHOE) && Set_size(predicates))
01438         {
01439           int reg, k, preg;
01440           ITintmax mask = 0;
01441           Set avail_callee = NULL;
01442           R_Physical_Bank *bank;
01443 
01444           bank = &R_bank[R_INT + R_CALLEE];
01445           avail_callee = bank ? Set_copy(*(bank->used_reg)) : NULL;
01446 
01447           for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
01448             {
01449               if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_MACRO ||
01450                   vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY)
01451                 continue;
01452               
01453               if (vreg->rclass != R_CALLEE)
01454                 continue;
01455 
01456               preg = vreg->phys_reg;
01457 
01458               if (Set_in (vreg->live_range, oper->id) ||
01459                   L_in_oper_IN_set_reg (oper, vreg->index) ||
01460                   L_in_oper_OUT_set_reg (jsr_cb_array[i], oper, vreg->index,
01461                                          BOTH_PATHS) ||
01462                   R_jsr_defines_vreg (oper, preg))
01463                 avail_callee = Set_delete(avail_callee, preg);
01464             }
01465 
01466           if (Set_size(avail_callee))
01467             {
01468               int *avail_array = MALLOC (int, Set_size (avail_callee));
01469               n_reg = Set_2array (avail_callee, avail_array);
01470 
01471               reg = avail_array[0];
01472               L_warn ("R_insert_jsr_spill_fill_code: scavenging r%d",
01473                       reg);
01474 
01475               free (avail_array);
01476             }
01477           else
01478             {
01479               L_warn ("R_insert_jsr_spill_fill_code: absconding with r4");
01480               reg = 4 + TAHOE_INT_REG_BASE;
01481             }
01482 
01483           Set_dispose(avail_callee);
01484 
01485           n_reg = Set_2array (predicates, reg_array);
01486           Set_dispose(predicates);
01487           predicates = NULL;
01488 
01489           for (k = 0; k < n_reg; k++)
01490             {
01491               int r;
01492               vreg = VREG (reg_array[k]);
01493               r = vreg->phys_reg - TAHOE_PRED_REG_BASE;
01494               if (r > 15)
01495                 L_punt("Trying to save a callee-save predicate");
01496 
01497               mask |= 1 << r;
01498             }
01499 
01500           spill_instr = 
01501             O_pred_save_operation (L_copy_operand(oper->pred[0]),
01502                                    L_new_register_operand(reg,
01503                                                           L_CTYPE_LLONG,
01504                                                           L_PTYPE_NULL));
01505           n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_before (jsr_cb_array[i], oper,
01506                                                 spill_instr);
01507 
01508           caller_weight += n_instr * oper->weight;
01509 
01510           spill_instr = 
01511             O_pred_restore_operation (L_copy_operand(oper->pred[0]),
01512                                       L_new_register_operand(reg,
01513                                                              L_CTYPE_LLONG,
01514                                                              L_PTYPE_NULL),
01515                                       mask);
01516 
01517           n_instr = R_insert_spill_code_after (jsr_cb_array[i], oper,
01518                                                spill_instr);
01519           caller_weight += n_instr * oper->weight;
01520 
01521         }
01522 
01523       if (attr)
01524         oper->attr = L_delete_attr (oper->attr, attr);
01525 
01526       if ((pred_swap_stack - pred_spill_stack) > *pred_jsr_swap_space)
01527         *pred_jsr_swap_space = pred_swap_stack - pred_spill_stack;
01528 
01529       if ((int_swap_stack - int_spill_stack) > *int_jsr_swap_space)
01530         *int_jsr_swap_space = int_swap_stack - int_spill_stack;
01531 
01532       if ((fp_swap_stack - fp_spill_stack) > *fp_jsr_swap_space)
01533         *fp_jsr_swap_space = fp_swap_stack - fp_spill_stack;
01534 
01535       if (reg_array)
01536         free (reg_array);
01537       Set_dispose (jsr_save_reg[i]);
01538       if (not_spilled_for_next_jsr)
01539         Set_dispose (not_spilled_for_next_jsr);
01540 
01541       i++;
01542     }
01543 
01544   if (jsr_cb_array)
01545     free (jsr_cb_array);
01546   if (jsr_save_reg)
01547     free (jsr_save_reg);
01548 
01549   L_delete_operand (operand);
01550 
01551   total_caller_weight += caller_weight;
01552 
01553   return (*int_jsr_swap_space + *fp_jsr_swap_space + *pred_jsr_swap_space);
01554 }
Generated on Sat Aug 30 17:59:09 2014 for libregalloc by  1.4.7
